result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adam Lavelle Turner Sr

records.addlTxt: Justice Point Violation Report forwarded to Judge for review and filed.

Defendant Adam Lavelle Turner Sr appeared by video.  Attorney Haley E Wentz appeared by video for Adam Lavelle Turner Sr.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court admonished defendant as to Justice Point discharge report and ordered the defendant back on Justice Point and to report to Justice Point. 
Final pretrial proceeded.  State's offer stated on the record.  Defense rejects State's offer.  Case remains in jury trial posture.  Case is adjourned to 11-16-22 at 8:30 am for Jury Trial.
Defense Motion In Limine, filed.
Justice Point Discharge Report forwarded to Judge for review and filed.
State's Motion In Limine, filed.
filed.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.
Court modified the no contact order to a no-violent contact order.

Defendant Adam Lavelle Turner Sr appeared by video.  Attorney Haley E Wentz appeared by video for Adam Lavelle Turner Sr.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense is requesting the no contact order be modified to a no-violent contact order.  State does not object.  Court granted request to modify the no contact order to a non-violent contact order.
Defense is requesting final pretrial and jury trial dates. Case is adjourned to 10-14-22 at 1:30 pm for final pretrial and 11-16-22 at 8:30 am for jury trial.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Motion for Modification of Bail, filed.

Defendant Adam Lavelle Turner in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
Defense just received and offer and discovery and is requesting a status conference.  Case is adjourned to 9-13-22 at 1:30 pm for status conference.
  This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:

JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.
filed.

Attorney Haley E Wentz in court.  
Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Status conference held.  Defendant's appearance is waived.  Court is informed this matter belongs in DV court.  Case is reassigned to Judge Havas, Br. 10.  Case is adjourned to Br. 10.  Status conference scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

22RM032390  Actual Date Bond Posted with *sheriff
06/30/2022

Attorney Haley E Wentz in court, defendant Adam Lavelle Turner not in court, in custody.  Constatine Siapkaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant's appearance waived for today's proceedings. 
Case in court for scheduling. Defense advises the Court this case maybe be transfered to Br 30 as defendant has other pending matters. Defense requests an adjournmennt. 
Case adjourned back to Br 01.  Status conference scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
received and filed

Court ordered no contact with KGP (DOB 12.12.1981)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Adam Lavelle Turner in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Adam Lavelle Turner in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Adam Lavelle Turner appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant has lower number case(s) pending.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/76b667a0-98a1-69d4-e783-9185dc35fcc1  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
